website_summaries.verdict: A CSS-only book focused on offering a variety of helpful information most other books do not include.
pros: Fully updated to reflect the current version of CSS and modern web development practices and standards
A good reference guide for seasoned programmers wanting a refresher course on more advanced concepts
cons: Might not be as beginner-friendly or focused as most starting CSS books and guides

customer_reviews.title: This is a turotial, the manual is still missing
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot of information here, but most of it is inaccessible unless you're willing to go step-by-step, start-to-finish and complete the tutorials. It makes a very poor reference because the information in the book is incomplete until you complete the tutorials. Perhaps four or five stars for those who want a tutorial-based learning experience. One or two for those who want to cherry-pick the info they need.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce M.

customer_reviews.title: CSS-The Missing Manual-4rth Edition by David Sawyer McFarland
customer_reviews.text: This book is a good reference for the CSS newbie. It helps "bridge the gaps" that were present in the CSS course I took some 2 years ago in which many of the technical terminology was presented too fast and "glossed over" in the class. Wish that it would have had a section on the "Less" CSS processor along with the "Sass" that was covered. Didn't have time for all of the Tutorials. All in All, a valuable reference and worth its' price.
customer_reviews.author: SWM243

customer_reviews.title: It is an excellent course and other then one or two minor issues ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second edition I have purchased. It is an excellent course and other then one or two minor issues in the tutorials, which are a lot of fun, the course has moved me to the next level. It is important to have a basic understanding of HTML but I found the book engaging and I now use it as an excellent reference. I can't wait for the update to Dreamweaver CC 2015 I'm not a very good typist so I will let DW handle the basic typing and use What I learned to tweak the CSS. Buy the book you won't regret it, and by the way it's massive.
customer_reviews.author: JOEL LALONDE

customer_reviews.title: Great Reference Book
customer_reviews.text: The book is up to date on everything I've encountered. There is a ton of content, but it feels easy to navigate. This will provide with a ton of CSS skills and be a good foundation for making designs. I would recommend it as a reference manual. The book feels like it will last for a while, but will eventually suffer from wear.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: An excellent resource for Web Development
customer_reviews.text: This book is very well written and helped me develop a great understanding of CSS. The author explains the concepts and then takes you through a hand's on exercise that lets you see how it works. The hands on exercises are well thought out and very beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bailey

customer_reviews.title: 3 editions of the team book.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd edition of this book that I'm reading. I bought the 1st and 2nd editions and now the 4th. That says a lot about how good this series is. I really needed to get up to speed with HTML5 and CSS3 and was delighted to find this highly readable hàndbook by the same author offering exactly that. Whilst you only need basic HTML knowledge, those who have been building websites for a while longer will not be bored. Loads of useful stuff and some nice projects to work through.
customer_reviews.author: Les Dunning

customer_reviews.title: THE Design-for-the-Web Manual
customer_reviews.text: Very clearly written with good tutorials. It teaches the basics about how internet displays work. As one reviewer wrote, it sometimes teaches you something and then poof! tells you it's outdated and nobody uses that anymore, but that's a small price to pay for clear writing. The book provides a good foundation for web skills in general.
customer_reviews.author: Teadrinker

customer_reviews.title: The Best CSS Book
customer_reviews.text: After learning HTML, I found it difficult learning CSS. I bought CSS: The Definitive Guide but it was too theoretical until I came across Missing Manual. Every chapter was explained so well with clear examples including "positioning" which I found extremely difficult to learn in Definitive Guide. David Sawyer McFarlane is a great teacher.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This is a phenomenal book!
customer_reviews.text: This is a phenomenal book! It covers all of the details of CSS and explains everything in a very clear, precise and easy to understand language. It uses an "in other words" construct, where it explains even more clearly and from another perspective certain concept. The design of the book is beautiful, which is to expect from a CSS book, perfect margins, justified text, and from the side, you can see borders of different Parts of the book in the form of gray lines. It is very comprehensive, clear, detailed, well designed and organized. I would highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Edin

customer_reviews.title: It is well written and easy to understand with good tutorials following each chapter
customer_reviews.text: I found this book to be very informative and it taught me quite a few new things about CSS. It is well written and easy to understand with good tutorials following each chapter. My one complaint about this book is that it didn't go into much detail about media queries. It also didn't even mention the rest of the @ rules. Despite the lack of @ rules, I still give this book 5 stars because it is packed full of very useful knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: ... find a Word Press (or similar company) template you like, learning CSS from this excellent book may be ...
customer_reviews.text: If you want to design your own website and can't find a Word Press (or similar company) template you like, learning CSS from this excellent book may be your best alternative. McFarland's tutorials are clear and comprehensive.
customer_reviews.author: Veriflan

customer_reviews.title: Missing Manuals books have proven very useful for the basic/intermediate introduction to script languages such as ...
customer_reviews.text: Missing Manuals books have proven very useful for the basic/intermediate introduction to script languages such as CSS, HTML, Javascript. Recommended for an excellent crash course.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Idaho

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Guide to CSS
customer_reviews.text: A comprehensive and easy to read guide for gaining a full knowledge about CSS. Studying through examples with a help of online materials is there to make a web pro. Even the ones who never worked either with HTML or CSS can start with this book and end up with making high-quality web-sites.
customer_reviews.author: Zeljko Porobija

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 1/2 way through - priceless if you want to learn everything about CSS.
customer_reviews.author: ovstudio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book in the series.
customer_reviews.text: The book is written in a clear, concise manner with many examples to support the text.
customer_reviews.author: Tony (phrankenstign) Ortega

customer_reviews.title: good reference
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Missing Manual series. I use as a reference book and its very easy to find what I need quickly.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Very comprehensive and well written. If you want to learn CSS start with this book.
customer_reviews.author: E. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good read
customer_reviews.text: This book is very good. I have programming background, but struggled with css, and decided to have a go. The language is simple enough to follow and you don't have to be web expert to understand it. I was surprised with how much css has moved over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good manual for CSS
customer_reviews.text: I'm old-fashioned and like hard-copy references. This helps me with CSS codes I'm trying to implement.
customer_reviews.author: nina ford

customer_reviews.title: Could not have been more clear
customer_reviews.text: This book is so easy to understand the content. Learning css was easy peazy!
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Great book for learning, and understanding, CSS
customer_reviews.text: I found this book to be quite useful and I have learned a great deal by reading and going through the exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Riker

customer_reviews.title: A lot of information with good examples
customer_reviews.text: Learning Web programming by myself. Great books. I also got Html 5, PHP & Mysql, Javascript & Jquery.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Billl

customer_reviews.title: Good addition for creating websites
customer_reviews.text: The book is very comprehensive, and up to date (as of February 2016). Outstanding reference, as is most all of the Missing Manual series.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Easy read
customer_reviews.text: Very good book, well explained in every example and tutorial. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bourne

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend for CSS enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: The book has many examples and code. A great book that I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: brianl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Book arrived in great condition. I always learn a lot from "the missing manual" books.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl pugh

customer_reviews.title: it is a good reference tool
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a class, it is a good reference tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Very interesting and very useful. The best book I read about CSS and HTML.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book demystifies CSS and explains it clearly.
customer_reviews.text: I found using CSS to be like painting a house using tiny post-it notes, until I got this book. It does a very good job of explaining CSS obscure syntax and also provides clear and easy to understand examples. This book is a tremendous help for anybody who works with CSS.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Risser

customer_reviews.title: Good for newbies to CSS!
customer_reviews.text: Very comprehensive coverage of the subject. This is a good reference book for those who are new or who have been doing coding for a while. The tutorials are very helpful in helping the reader to understand what is verbally described in the book. There are also some key tips throughout the book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why Does a book that Teaches about Color and Design HAVE NO COLOR??
customer_reviews.text: Mostly good, conversational, and takes a useful "this is what was difficult in the past, and that is why we do it *this* way now" approach. My one complaint is this: WHY IS A BOOK ABOUT CSS -- Which is used for layout and color -- IN 100% BLACK AND WHITE ??? I will come back and update this review at a later date, but for now I want people to know that this book is in BLACK AND WHITE, not COLOR.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L. Hepperle

customer_reviews.title: Missing Manual Missing information too.!
customer_reviews.text: The information in this manual is missing as well as the manual. The info is outdated and some of it does not work in the newest browsers. Don't waste your money on this text. I found it totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: helpful book
customer_reviews.text: IIf you need to learn CSS this is a great book. I had to buy it for a class but still refer back to it at times for reference
customer_reviews.author: trp

customer_reviews.title: Great CSS book
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book already being familiar with CSS, so I was worried the information would be repetitive and unhelpful to me, but I ended up buying it anyway. I'm really happy I did because this book has a LOT of good information; I thought I was pretty fluent in CSS to begin with but there was a lot I actually didn't know that I wouldn't have realized if it weren't for this book. Even if you're a complete beginner, this book will be great for you as well. I was overall very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne S

customer_reviews.title: Yep, you should get it!
customer_reviews.text: I was first quite skeptical about a book that claimed to teach CSS while serving as a reference manual to be honest but McFarland has found a way to do both. It's been a refreshing surprise since I've read a least a dozen books related to web development where one of two phenomenon usually occurs, either the book is too impractical or it's only a reference. I am a bit of a critic and this book doesn't change that but I have to give credit where it's due. Extremely well written, concise and to the point. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Overall Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I thought it was a pretty good book. A good book for someone just starting out in CSS as it covers the basis of CSS and goes into CSS3. Some of the CSS3 features I'm not sure it covers in great depth but gives a good overview. For most part the writing is good and easy to follow, but a few areas it gets a little dry. Worth a read if your starting out.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: The tutorials are great
customer_reviews.text: The strength of this book is in the tutorials. As the adage goes: "I read, I forget. I do, I remember." Going through the tutorials and actually coding them up and playing around with them helped me really learn CSS.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Li
